name: UI UX Design Course For Beginners
description: In this course, you will learn the fundamentals of user interface and user experience design. You will gain a strong understanding of user-centered design principles and processes, and develop skills in user research, information architecture, interaction design, visual design, and usability testing. Through hands-on projects and exercises, you will learn how to create effective and engaging designs for websites, mobile apps, and other digital products. By the end of the course, you will have a strong portfolio of work and the skills to succeed in the exciting field of UI/UX design.
OutlineOnePeraOne: Understanding the difference between UI and UX
OutlineThreePeraTwo: Creating site maps and user flows
OutlineSixPeraOne: Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, InVision, etc.
OutlineSevenPeraOne: Applying all the skills learned in the course to design and create a final project
OutlineSevenPeraTow: Presenting the final project and receiving feedback

name: Full Stack Web Development
description: In this exciting course, you'll discover the fundamental building blocks of web development, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. From there, you'll explore cutting-edge tools and frameworks like React, Node.js, and MongoDB to create stunning, interactive web applications. With our expert guidance, you'll develop the skills and knowledge needed to build your own dynamic web projects from scratch!
outlineTwoTittle: Module 2: Setting up the Development Environment
outlineTwelveTittle: Module 12 Introduction to Sequelize ORM and MySQL
OutlineOnePeraOne: Web development refers to the creation and maintenance of websites and web applications.
OutlineOnePeraTwo: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are the basic building blocks of a web page.
OutlineOnePeraThree: HTML is used to create the structure of a web page, CSS is used to style it, and JavaScript is used to add interactivity.
OutlineOnePeraFour: Understanding web development is important for creating engaging and functional websites.
OutlineTwoPeraOne: Setting up a development environment involves installing the necessary software and tools required for web development.
OutlineTwoPeraTwo: JavaScript, React, Node.js, and MongoDB are commonly used technologies in web development.
OutlineTwoPeraThree: The installation of dependencies and tools is necessary to ensure that the development environment is functional and stable.
OutlineTwoPeraFour: Having a properly configured development environment is essential for efficient and effective web development.
OutlineThreePeraOne: HTML is a markup language used for creating the structure and content of a web page.
OutlineThreePeraTwo: The basic syntax and structure of HTML involve using tags to define elements on a web page
OutlineThreePeraThree: CSS is a styling language used for creating the visual layout of a web page.
OutlineThreePeraFour: Common HTML tags and CSS properties are essential for designing and formatting a web page.
OutlineFourPeraOne: Bootstrap is a popular front-end development framework used for designing responsive and mobile-first websites
OutlineFourPeraTwo: Bootstrap provides a library of CSS styles and pre-built components that can be used to speed up development
OutlineFourPeraThree: Including Bootstrap in a web page involves adding the framework's CSS and JavaScript files to the HTML
OutlineFourPeraFour: Knowing how to use Bootstrap can help streamline the development process and create visually appealing websites.
OutlineFivePeraOne: Tailwind is a utility-first CSS framework used for quickly and efficiently designing and building custom user interfaces.
OutlineFivePeraTwo: Tailwind provides a comprehensive set of pre-defined utility classes that can be used to style HTML elements.
OutlineFivePeraThree: Including Tailwind in a web page involves adding the framework's CSS file to the HTML.
OutlineFivePeraFour: Knowing how to use Tailwind can help speed up the development process and create consistent and responsive user interfaces.
OutlineSixPeraOne: JavaScript is a programming language used to add interactivity to web pages.
OutlineSixPeraTwo: The basic syntax and structure of JavaScript involve using variables, functions, and control flow statements to manipulate data and respond to events.
OutlineSixPeraThree: JavaScript can be used for creating animations, validating form inputs, and interacting with APIs, among other things.
OutlineSixPeraFour: Understanding JavaScript is essential for creating dynamic and interactive web pages.
OutlineSevenPeraOne: Advanced programming concepts in JavaScript include working with arrays, objects, and loops.
OutlineSevenPeraTow: The Document Object Model (DOM) is a programming interface for interacting with HTML and CSS using JavaScript.
OutlineSevenPeraThree: Manipulating the DOM using JavaScript allows for dynamically updating and changing the content and style of a web page.
OutlineSevenPeraFour: Knowing advanced JavaScript concepts can help create more complex and feature-rich web applications.
OutlineEightPeraOne: React is a popular JavaScript library used for building user interfaces.
OutlineEightPeraTwo: Setting up a React project involves installing the necessary dependencies and configuring the development environment.
OutlineEightPeraThree: React is based on the concept of components, which are reusable pieces of code that can be used to build complex user interfaces.
OutlineEightPeraFour: Understanding React is essential for building scalable and efficient web applications.
OutlineNinePeraOne: Advanced React concepts such as hooks, lifecycle methods, and conditional rendering.
OutlineNinePeraTwo: Introduction to popular React libraries such as React Router and Redux.
OutlineNinePeraThree: How to handle forms and user input in React using controlled components.
OutlineNinePeraFour: Best practices for managing state and designing reusable components in React.
OutlineTenPeraOne: Overview of Node.js, its features, and how it works.
OutlineTenPeraTwo: How to create a server with Node.js and use the core modules to interact with the file system and network.
OutlineTenPeraThree: How to use the Express.js framework to create a RESTful API, handle routing, and implement middleware.
OutlineTenPeraFour: Introduction to server-side templating and using third-party modules with Node.js.
OutlineElevenPeraOne: Overview of MongoDB and how it differs from traditional relational databases.
OutlineElevenPeraTwo: How to create, read, update, and delete data in MongoDB using the Query API.
OutlineElevenPeraThree: Working with MongoDB drivers for Node.js and connecting to a database from a Node.js application.
OutlineElevenPeraFour: Introduction to data modeling in MongoDB and best practices for structuring data.
OutlineTwelvePeraOne: Basic concepts of Sequelize ORM and how it simplifies database access in Node.js applications.
OutlineTwelvePerTwo: How to connect Sequelize with a MySQL database and define database models.
OutlineTwelvePerThree: Performing CRUD (create, read, update, delete) operations on a MySQL database using Sequelize.
OutlineTwelvePerFour: Introduction to data migrations and seeding data in a Sequelize and MySQL project.
OutlineThirteenPerOne: How to define database models in Sequelize and the different data types that can be used.
OutlineThirteenPerTwo: Defining relationships between database models using Sequelize associations.
OutlineThirteenPerThree: Using Sequelize to create, read, update, and delete data from a database.
OutlineThirteenPerFour: Introduction to Sequelize hooks and instance methods for adding custom logic to model operations.
OutlineFourteenPerOne: Types of associations in Sequelize and when to use them (one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-many).
OutlineFourteenPerTwo: How to define associations between models using Sequelize and create queries with associations.
OutlineFourteenPerThree: Best practices for designing database models with associations in Sequelize.
OutlineFourteenPerFour: Introduction to Sequelize migrations for modifying database schemas and data with code.

name: Front End Development
description: Welcome to our Frontend Web Development Course! In this course, we will guide you through the fundamentals of web development, starting with the basic building blocks of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. We'll cover setting up your development environment, including installation of required dependencies and tools. You'll learn about popular frameworks like Bootstrap and Tailwind, and delve into more advanced programming concepts such as loops, objects, and the Document Object Model (DOM). Finally, we'll explore React and its components, props, and state. By the end of this course, you'll have the skills and knowledge needed to build dynamic and engaging web applications.

name: Backend Development
description: This Backend web development course covers the essential skills and knowledge required to build web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, MongoDB, and Sequelize ORM. Students will learn how to create responsive web pages, set up a development environment, work with databases, and implement user authentication and authorization. The course includes hands-on exercises and projects to help students gain practical experience in web development. By the end of the course, students will be able to build functional web applications from scratch.

outlineSixTittle: Module 6: Introduction to Sequelize ORM and MySQL
